pageContext.Title: Javascript - Modules, Package Managers and Bundlers
pageContext.Description:
In the old days (I mean, around 2010) life was simple: if you wanted to use a Javascript library you'd just go their website, download a .js file plug it into your website and voil√†: things were already working. In modern times, though, the web development ecosystem became a lot more powerful but also a lot more complicated and everything has many (like, many) dependencies. That is why we need to use package managers such as npm or yarn.

In this Guide you will explore these softwares to learn how they can help your workflow.

Knowledge.Knowledge: Understand what is a package manager

Skills.Skill: Be able to use a package manager such as npm
Be able to bundle a code base

actionPoints.actionPoint: Learn what are Modules in Javascript
Compare ES6 Modules and CommonJS modules to find out their differences
Learn how to use npm to install a package (start with cowsay?)
Create a modular application (can contain 2-3 modules) and bundle it with Parcel or similar

Deliver.Title: Reusable module
Deliver.Description:
• Submit:
    • Glitch Project URL or Github Repository + Github Pages URLs
      • Add comments for each relevant code block
    • Project description and details in the README.md file
  • Minimum requirements:
    • Create a Module that can be used in any web page to add some feature
    • Demonstrate the usage in a demo file bundled with Parcel
      • Possible to use other bundlers
    • Can be a back-end module (Node)
  • Theme ideas:
    • Modal creator
    • Add decoration around mouse pointer
    • Improved alert messages
    • Cookies notice
